issue.title: Stuck in UA_EventLoopPOSIX_pollFDs
issue.body:
When trying to connect to a invalid address, there's an endless loop. I tried debugging, timeout is set to 5000.

Code is following:
```
UA_Client *client = UA_Client_new();
UA_ClientConfig_setDefault(UA_Client_getConfig(client));
UA_StatusCode retval = UA_Client_connect(client, this->opcuaUrl.c_str());
```

When I force quit (ctrl + c) this error message shows:
```
     [2023-10-19 11:22:18.366 (UTC+0200)] warn/eventloop     Timeout during poll
```
These messages were shown before the one above
```
[2023-10-19 11:22:06.699 (UTC+0200)] info/client        Client Status: ChannelState: Fresh, SessionState: Closed, ConnectStatus: BadConnectionRejected
[2023-10-19 11:22:06.700 (UTC+0200)] info/network       TCP 5   | Socket closed
```

When debuging, it seems to be stuck in function UA_EventLoopPOSIX_pollFDs at following line
```
int events = epoll_wait(epollfd, epoll_events, 64,
                            (int)(listenTimeout / UA_DATETIME_MSEC));
```

What's weird as well, if I pause it via debugger where it stuck and resume it, it conitnues throwing out the Timeout during poll(normal behavior). I'm not sure how that's possible.

 - [X ] open62541 Version (release number or git tag): v1.3.8
 - [X] Operating system: Ubuntu/WSL 

Edit:
hardcoing the timeout to 5ms in epoll_wait doesn't seem to fix the problem.

Edit2:
after some more testing it seems to only happen on "opc.tcp://localhost:4840" while the server is not running, trying connecting to "opc.tcp://test4840" doesn't hang. 
After some more testing it just checks if it's a valid IP format. If it's another IP which has a valid format but I can't connect to it at all it gets stuck in a poll as well, pressing ctrl + c gives the Timeout during poll error but still stays stuck. Not like with a valid IP where I can quit out via ctrl + c.

comment.body:
I suspect this has something to do with DNS lookup.
We might have to change to an async DNS lookup outside of the typical POSIX API.

Are you on the 1.3 branch (as indicated) or on 1.4/master?
I'm asking because the epoll call looks rather like something we would do on a more recent development version.

issue.title: handle predefined structs with std::string/CString members

comment.body:
We have the type UA_String and UA_ByteString.
Both are "just" a length field and a pointer to a byte-array.
The conversion to and from std::string should be straightforward.

issue.title: [Discussion] UA_FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT on MSVC
issue.body:
UA_FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT for GCC is defined as "__attribute__((warn_unused_result))" [here](https://github.com/open62541/open62541/blob/effaeb395bded7e31f62ad4d7001c9ded8f2ae60/include/open62541/config.h.in#L494C5-L494C5). For MSVC is defined as "_Check_return_" [here](https://github.com/open62541/open62541/blob/effaeb395bded7e31f62ad4d7001c9ded8f2ae60/include/open62541/config.h.in#L501).
For MSVC "_Check_return_" MUST be at beginning but now it is at end. It make static analysis on windows fails.
According to [this](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/4226308/msvc-equivalent-of-attribute-warn-unused-result) GCC allows attribute at the beginning. So, macro can be changed from end to beginning making it compatible for GCC and MSVC. For example:
[here](https://github.com/open62541/open62541/blob/effaeb395bded7e31f62ad4d7001c9ded8f2ae60/src/ua_types_encoding_binary.h#L40).

`UA_StatusCode UA_encodeBinaryInternal(const void *src, const UA_DataType *type, UA_Byte **bufPos, const UA_Byte **bufEnd, UA_exchangeEncodeBuffer exchangeCallback, void *exchangeHandle) UA_FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT;`

`UA_FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT UA_StatusCode UA_encodeBinaryInternal(const void *src, const UA_DataType *type, UA_Byte **bufPos, const UA_Byte **bufEnd, UA_exchangeEncodeBuffer exchangeCallback, void *exchangeHandle);`

comment.body:
Sounds good.
You can open a PR if you want.

commits.message: fix(server): Bug fixes in the subscription transfer service.

pull_request.title: fix(server): Bug fixes in the subscription transfer service.
pull_request.body:
* [x] Fixed a bug where after transferring a subscription and deleting the old session, the publish callback was no longer called.
* [x] Subscriptions that were transferred to another Session must be deleted by the Client that owns the Session.
* [x] Implementation of the allowTransferSubscription function. The function must check if a transfer is allowed. Currently it always returns true.

issue.title: What is "error/eventloop    Cannot run EventLoop from the run method itself" about?
issue.body:
## Description
I keep getting the following error **error/eventloop    Cannot run EventLoop from the run method itself** from the client logs using this  client code:
[examples/client_subscription_loop.c](https://github.com/open62541/open62541/blob/e71c8a4973820bdec58ff25ea6cef782e4249a4a/examples/client_subscription_loop.c)
with this server code from examples: 
[examples/tutorial_server_monitoreditems.c](https://github.com/open62541/open62541/blob/e71c8a4973820bdec58ff25ea6cef782e4249a4a/examples/tutorial_server_monitoreditems.c)
and UA_ENABLE_SUBSCRIPTION is ON.
it seems like this line:
https://github.com/open62541/open62541/blob/e71c8a4973820bdec58ff25ea6cef782e4249a4a/examples/client_subscription_loop.c#L79-L80
always returns a response with bad status code.



Logs from the client:
```
[2023-10-17 09:52:50.626 (UTC+0200)] info/network       TCP 4   | New connection to "localhost" on port 4840
[2023-10-17 09:52:50.626 (UTC+0200)] info/network       TCP 5   | Socket closed
[2023-10-17 09:52:50.626 (UTC+0200)] info/userland      Waiting for ack
[2023-10-17 09:52:50.626 (UTC+0200)] info/userland      Waiting for OPN Response
[2023-10-17 09:52:50.626 (UTC+0200)] info/channel       TCP 4   | SC 3714       | SecureChannel opened with SecurityPolicy http://opcfoundation.org/UA/SecurityPolicy#None and a revised lifetime of 600.00s
[2023-10-17 09:52:50.626 (UTC+0200)] info/client        Client Status: ChannelState: Open, SessionState: Created, ConnectStatus: Good
[2023-10-17 09:52:50.626 (UTC+0200)] info/userland      A SecureChannel to the server is open
[2023-10-17 09:52:50.626 (UTC+0200)] info/userland      A SecureChannel to the server is open
[2023-10-17 09:52:50.626 (UTC+0200)] info/client        Client Status: ChannelState: Open, SessionState: Activated, ConnectStatus: Good
[2023-10-17 09:52:50.626 (UTC+0200)] info/userland      A SecureChannel to the server is open
[2023-10-17 09:52:50.626 (UTC+0200)] info/userland      A session with the server is activated
[2023-10-17 09:52:50.626 (UTC+0200)] error/eventloop    Cannot run EventLoop from the run method itself
[2023-10-17 09:52:50.627 (UTC+0200)] warn/client        Request with unknown RequestId 2982
[2023-10-17 09:52:50.627 (UTC+0200)] error/client       Processing the message returned the error code BadSecurityChecksFailed
[2023-10-17 09:52:50.627 (UTC+0200)] warn/client        Client connection already initiated
[2023-10-17 09:52:50.627 (UTC+0200)] info/client        Client Status: ChannelState: Closing, SessionState: Created, ConnectStatus: Good
[2023-10-17 09:52:50.627 (UTC+0200)] info/channel       TCP 0   | SC 0  | Closed the SecureChannel
[2023-10-17 09:52:50.627 (UTC+0200)] warn/client        skip verifying ApplicationURI for the SecurityPolicy http://opcfoundation.org/UA/SecurityPolicy#None
[2023-10-17 09:52:50.627 (UTC+0200)] info/network       TCP 5   | New connection to "localhost" on port 4840
[2023-10-17 09:52:50.627 (UTC+0200)] info/network       TCP 4   | Socket closed
[2023-10-17 09:52:50.627 (UTC+0200)] info/userland      Waiting for ack
[2023-10-17 09:52:50.627 (UTC+0200)] info/userland      Waiting for OPN Response
[2023-10-17 09:52:50.627 (UTC+0200)] info/channel       TCP 5   | SC 3715       | SecureChannel opened with SecurityPolicy http://opcfoundation.org/UA/SecurityPolicy#None and a revised lifetime of 600.00s
[2023-10-17 09:52:50.627 (UTC+0200)] info/client        Client Status: ChannelState: Open, SessionState: Created, ConnectStatus: Good
[2023-10-17 09:52:50.627 (UTC+0200)] info/userland      A SecureChannel to the server is open
[2023-10-17 09:52:50.627 (UTC+0200)] info/userland      A SecureChannel to the server is open
[2023-10-17 09:52:50.627 (UTC+0200)] info/client        Client Status: ChannelState: Open, SessionState: Activated, ConnectStatus: Good
[2023-10-17 09:52:50.627 (UTC+0200)] info/userland      A SecureChannel to the server is open
[2023-10-17 09:52:50.627 (UTC+0200)] info/userland      A session with the server is activated
[2023-10-17 09:52:50.627 (UTC+0200)] error/eventloop    Cannot run EventLoop from the run method itself
[2023-10-17 09:52:50.629 (UTC+0200)] warn/client        Request with unknown RequestId 2986
[2023-10-17 09:52:50.629 (UTC+0200)] error/client       Processing the message returned the error code BadSecurityChecksFailed
[2023-10-17 09:52:50.629 (UTC+0200)] warn/client        Client connection already initiated
[2023-10-17 09:52:50.629 (UTC+0200)] info/client        Client Status: ChannelState: Closing, SessionState: Created, ConnectStatus: Good
```


Logs on server side:
```
[2023-10-17 10:19:35.990 (UTC+0200)] info/channel       TCP 9   | SC 410        | SecureChannel created
[2023-10-17 10:19:35.990 (UTC+0200)] info/channel       TCP 0   | SC 0  | SecureChannel closed
[2023-10-17 10:19:35.990 (UTC+0200)] info/network       TCP 10  | Socket closed
[2023-10-17 10:19:35.990 (UTC+0200)] info/channel       TCP 9   | SC 410        | SecureChannel opened with SecurityPolicy http://opcfoundation.org/UA/SecurityPolicy#None and a revised lifetime of 600.00s
[2023-10-17 10:19:35.990 (UTC+0200)] warn/client        Could not find a SecurityPolicy with encryption for the UserTokenPolicy. Using an unencrypted policy.
[2023-10-17 10:19:35.990 (UTC+0200)] info/session       TCP 9   | SC 410        | Session "ns=1;g=374f8057-9288-37de-12a1-5af5614614c1"   | ActivateSession: Session attached to new channel
[2023-10-17 10:19:35.990 (UTC+0200)] info/session       TCP 9   | SC 410        | Session "ns=1;g=374f8057-9288-37de-12a1-5af5614614c1"   | ActivateSession: Session activated with ClientUserId ""
[2023-10-17 10:19:35.993 (UTC+0200)] info/session       TCP 9   | SC 410        | Session "ns=1;g=374f8057-9288-37de-12a1-5af5614614c1"   | Subscription 410 | Subscription created (Publishing interval 500.00ms, max 1000 notifications per publish)
[2023-10-17 10:19:35.994 (UTC+0200)] info/network       TCP 10  | Connection opened from "127.0.0.1" via the server socket 5
[2023-10-17 10:19:35.994 (UTC+0200)] info/channel       TCP 10  | SC 411        | SecureChannel created
[2023-10-17 10:19:35.994 (UTC+0200)] info/channel       TCP 0   | SC 0  | SecureChannel closed
[2023-10-17 10:19:35.994 (UTC+0200)] info/network       TCP 9   | Socket closed
[2023-10-17 10:19:35.994 (UTC+0200)] info/channel       TCP 10  | SC 411        | SecureChannel opened with SecurityPolicy http://opcfoundation.org/UA/SecurityPolicy#None and a revised lifetime of 600.00s
[2023-10-17 10:19:35.994 (UTC+0200)] warn/client        Could not find a SecurityPolicy with encryption for the UserTokenPolicy. Using an unencrypted policy.
[2023-10-17 10:19:35.994 (UTC+0200)] info/session       TCP 10  | SC 411        | Session "ns=1;g=374f8057-9288-37de-12a1-5af5614614c1"   | ActivateSession: Session attached to new channel
[2023-10-17 10:19:35.994 (UTC+0200)] info/session       TCP 10  | SC 411        | Session "ns=1;g=374f8057-9288-37de-12a1-5af5614614c1"   | ActivateSession: Session activated with ClientUserId ""
[2023-10-17 10:19:35.996 (UTC+0200)] info/session       TCP 10  | SC 411        | Session "ns=1;g=374f8057-9288-37de-12a1-5af5614614c1"   | Subscription 411 | Subscription created (Publishing interval 500.00ms, max 1000 notifications per publish)
```

Used CMake options:


```bash
cmake ..
```

## Checklist


 - [x] open62541 Version (release number or git tag): 1.3.8-1356-g744ea7edf
 - [x] Other OPC UA SDKs used (client or server): None
 - [x] Operating system: Ubuntu 22.04
 - [x] Logs (with `UA_LOGLEVEL` set as low as necessary) attached
 - [ ] Wireshark network dump attached
 - [ ] Self-contained code example attached
 - [ ] Critical issue

issue.title: What is "error/eventloop    Cannot run EventLoop from the run method itself" about?
issue.body:
## Description
I keep getting the following error **error/eventloop    Cannot run EventLoop from the run method itself** from the client logs using this  client code:
[examples/client_subscription_loop.c](https://github.com/open62541/open62541/blob/e71c8a4973820bdec58ff25ea6cef782e4249a4a/examples/client_subscription_loop.c)

it seems like this line:
https://github.com/open62541/open62541/blob/e71c8a4973820bdec58ff25ea6cef782e4249a4a/examples/client_subscription_loop.c#L79-L80

comment.body: Thank you for the response, by using the async method it worked fine.
I did that first. But then some tests fail. After the transfer, a publish is done on the old session and a statusChange notification is expected. This is not sent otherwise.

pull_request.title: fix(server): Bug fixes in the subscription transfer service.
pull_request.body:
* [x] Fixed a bug where after transferring a subscription and deleting the old session, the publish callback was no longer called.
* [x] Subscriptions that were transferred to another Session must be deleted by the Client that owns the Session.
* [x] Implementation of the allowTransferSubscription function. The function must check if a transfer is allowed. Currently it always returns true.

comment.body:
In case where the subscription is not deleted we still should disable it.
Otherwise it continues to send out keepalives, etc.

pull_request.title: fix(server): Bug fixes in the subscription transfer service.
pull_request.body:
* [x] Fixed a bug where after transferring a subscription and deleting the old session, the publish callback was no longer called.
* [x] Subscriptions that were transferred to another Session must be deleted by the Client that owns the Session.
* [x] Implementation of the allowTransferSubscription function. The function must check if a transfer is allowed. Currently it always returns true.

issue.title: Solution for export OPC UA to XML like as in open62541-nodeset-loader.
issue.body:
Hello!
In the open62541 was integrated open62541-nodeset-loader for importing XML structure to nodeset. And I have a question, will there be some solution to export OPC UA to XML?
